title: Heiress Francesca Packer Barham buys $16m Horizon apartment
text:
Heiress Francesca Packer Barham is only 24 but has already developed her family’s propensity for high-end real estate, snapping up the largest apartment in Darlinghurst’s landmark Horizon building on Friday.

The purchase price remains undisclosed but the whole-floor spread was passed in at auction on a vendor bid of $16 million on Saturday and agents had been in negotiations with buyers since.

While it is not the $60 million spread her uncle James Packer bought in Crown Resorts’ One Barangaroo and is a downsize from her mother Gretel Packer’s Bellevue Hill mansion Winston, it is a significant step-up from the $2.1 million pad she bought in Elizabeth Bay in 2016.

The whole floor of level 40 in the Horizon building has sold a week after it was passed in on a $16 million vendor bid Supplied

Ms Packer Barham bought the level 40 apartment after a major renovation was undertaken in recent years, in which the vast 565 square metres of internal living space was gutted and redesigned with interiors by Melbourne firm Mim Design.

It is just down the road from the Macleay Regis penthouse bought by her billionaire mother for $8.75 million two years ago.
description: The Packer family are renowned for their high-end taste in real estate so the largest apartment in this well-known building is a somewhat fitting purchase by Gretel Packer's eldest daughter.
